author: Joefish
title: This is a GREAT SET!
review:
Opinion

This is a GREAT SET! I've always looked at these mini-packs as offering questionable value-for-money as they tend to recycle past minifigures with unimpressive accessories. And minifigure packs always seem to have quite a high price (70841: Benny's Space Squad being a delightful exception).

But this one offers some interesting figures, not one but TWO much sought-after after teddy-bears, and a genuinely playable mini-game in the shooting gallery.

Minifigures

First off, the minifigures - two great shirts for the stallholders and a gorgeous unique unicorn shirt for the little girl (with matching face paint). The moustache and top hat are great fun and the Dad's hair is a nice piece only available so far in one other set (60258: Tuning Workshop).

Parts and Accessories

Then there are the accessories. The two medium-blue bears are a generous inclusion for LEGO; some might say it's a shame they're not two different colours, but production-wise it's much easier for them to put two the same in a set than have to include another different part, so no complaint there. This is really good value. This colour has appeared in the Build-a-Minifigure towers in LEGO stores, but so far hasn't appeared in any other set.

The decorative yellow printed tile is bright and appropriate - I'd like more of these myself - and the three printed ring-pulls for the tops of the drink-can targets are (again) a surprising bit of generosity from LEGO. You could always replace these with ordinary grey caps and use the printed ones to give your minifigures a drink or stock a small shop. Finally, click on the 'Parts' link above and just look at the four gold items you get too!

And then there's the fact that you can actually use the stud-shooter to play the shooting gallery yourself!

Overall

You can view this set either as an expansion of, or a pleasing low-cost alternative to, 60234: People Pack - Fun Fair, and happily add it to any of LEGO's other funfair sets and rides.

Well done LEGO. A useful and fun accessory pack, and it comes in an attractive minfigure-shaped blister-pack, which could even be painted or used as a mould or tray.
